data.question: What is the formula for the di-substituted axial-axial product synthesized from compound 1?
What type of geometry does the Cu(II) ion exhibit in the 1D polymer chain formed by reacting compound 2 with copper nitrate?
Is the [3]-rotaxane {(H2T1)[Cr7NiF8(O2CtBu)16]2} formed by using a thread that contains pyridine groups at each end?
What is the yield percentage for the synthesis of thread N,N'-bis(pyridin-4-ylmethyl)decane-1,10-diamine (T1)?
How does the angle between the isonicotinate groups change in the 1D-polymer formed by reacting compound 3 with copper nitrate?
data.answer: The angle reduces from 115.71 in the free 'link' to around 95 degrees

data.question: Does the synthesis of poly-[3]-rotaxane 8 involve the reaction of [3]-rotaxane 7 with [Cu2(O2CtBu)4]?
What is the main reason discrete molecules are formed instead of a 1D polymer when attempting to form a polymer with monometallic units using [3]-rotaxane 7?
data.answer: Due to the steric bulk near the pyridyl group within 7

data.question: Is the poly-[3]-rotaxane 8 a type of metal–organic rotaxane framework where the thread is continuous and does not contain blocking groups?
What change is made to the thread to facilitate the formation of a polymer with [Cu(Hfac)2] after initial attempts resulted in discrete molecules?
data.answer: Adding an extra CH2 group to the thread between the amine and the pyridyl moiety

data.question: What is the formula for the polymer formed by reacting the new [3]-rotaxane with [Cu(Hfac)2]?
Does the synthesis of [3]-rotaxane 7 involve the use of diisopropylamine?
What is the coordination environment of CuA in the 1D-polymer formed by reacting compound 3 with copper nitrate?
data.answer: Square based pyramidal geometry with three iso-nicotinate groups along with a solvent molecule in the basal plane and a nitrate ion in the apical position

data.question: What is the yield percentage for the synthesis of poly-[3]-rotaxane 8?
Is the reaction of compound 2 with [Cu2(O2CtBu)4] to form a 1D chain 5 an example of a polymerization reaction?
What is the role of the [Cu2(O2CtBu)4] units in the structure of poly-[3]-rotaxane 8?
data.answer: They prevent the {Cr7Ni} clusters from slipping along the entire length of the polymer chain, making each repeat unit a discrete [3]-rotaxane

data.question: What is the formula for the compound used as a linker in the synthesis of 1D coordination polymers and metal–organic rotaxane frameworks?
Does the synthesis of compound 2 involve refluxing compound 1 in an excess of iso-nicotinic acid?
What is the geometry of the Cu(II) ions in the 1D-polymer formed by reacting compound 2 with [Cu2(O2CtBu)4]?
data.answer: The Cu(II) ions in the dimer [Cu2(O2CtBu)4] remain intact and are part of the polymer structure

data.question: Is the synthesis of [3]-rotaxane 7 an example of using functionalised inorganic nanoscale clusters to link between metal sites?
What is the main difference between poly-[3]-rotaxane 8 and other metal–organic rotaxane frameworks reported by the Loeb group?
data.answer: Poly-[3]-rotaxane 8 is linked through the thread with blocking groups, making each repeat unit a discrete [3]-rotaxane, unlike the continuous thread or ring-linked frameworks reported by the Loeb group
